bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 28 (Thursday, February 16, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. HOLDING:H.R. 1150.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8 ``The Congress shall have Power Tolay and collect Taxes, Duties, Imposts and Excises, [. . .]''[Page H1304]

latestAction.text: Returned to the Calendar. Calendar No. 120.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.latestTitle: Shiloh National Military Park Boundary Adjustment and Parker's Crossroads Battlefield Designation Act

latestAction.text: Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate amendment.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

Tanning Tax Repeal Act of 2017

This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal the 10% excise tax on indoor tanning services.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Tanning Tax Repeal Act of 2017

item.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the excise tax on indoor tanning services.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
